column2: Oil companies played hardball in bid to defeat climate outsiders HOUSTON Petty legal filings. Diversionary ballot measures. Counting abstentions as no votes. column2: Walgreen settles Medicaid false billing case in New YorkWalgreen settles Medicaid false billing case in New York NEW YORK Walgreen Co will pay $2.55 million to settle charges by New York's attorney general that a pharmacy unit improperly billed Medicaid for costly drugs to treat hemophilia patients
column3: without proof that it actually delivered the drugs to those patients. column2: DEALS-Second-quarter M&A; close to record amid mega deals NEW YORK/LONDON
column3: June 29 Mergers and acquisitions (M&A;) worldwide in the second quarter of 2015 almost matched the record set in the second quarter of 2007
column4: according to preliminary Thomson Reuters data
column5: as big companies turned to deals to boost their market share.
